thread.title: Terry Rozier injury: Boston Celtics guard out 3-5 days with knee swelling
thread.title_full: Terry Rozier injury: Boston Celtics guard out 3-5 days with knee swelling

author: Jay King | mjking@masslive.com
title: Terry Rozier injury: Boston Celtics guard out 3-5 days with knee swelling
text:
Comments 
WALTHAM -- Boston Celtics rookie Terry Rozier could miss a bit of preseason action this week due to left knee swelling, according to head coach Brad Stevens. 
Rozier did not practice Sunday. As his teammates ended the session with shooting and conditioning work, the guard walked along the sideline with a wrap on his knee, moving well enough to celebrate an exciting finish to the drill. 
Stevens said he expects Rozier to miss three to five days, which could put his status in jeopardy for at least one preseason game this week. The Celtics play Wednesday at Brooklyn and Friday at New York. 
Stevens did not explain what caused the swelling, but knee tendinitis has bothered Rozier periodically since his time at Louisville. Over the offseason, he said the issue popped up again after he competed for the Celtics in two summer leagues. He took two weeks of rest before returning to the court.
